Cairn of Claise

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Cairn of Claise is a fairly insignificant rise on the wide plateau on the east side of the Cairnwell Pass. A large stone wall crosses close by the summit marking the old county boundary.

 You have not climbed Cairn of Claise.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 1064 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.39/5
Rating: 2.4/5 (110 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Glas Maol Munros from the Cairnwell Pass

Other routes and challenges

The route above could be lengthened to take in Tolmount and Tom Buidhe across the plateau.

An alternative, more dramatic approach to Cairn of Claise would be to ascend from Glen Isla, perhaps along the Monega Hill ridge of Glas Maol, or via Caenlochan Glen and Caderg.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Braemar Hotels

Braemar B&B

Braemar cottages

Cairngorms hostels
